Package games.negative.alumina.menu.base

Interface AluminaMenu

All Known Implementing Classes:
ChestMenu
public interface AluminaMenu
Represents the base class for all custom menus.

  • Method Details

    • setItem

      void setItem(int slot, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item, @Nullable @Nullable String functionKey)
      This method will allow you to set a functional item in the menu.
      Parameters:
      slot - The slot to set the item in.
      item - The item to set.
      functionKey - The function key to set. When the function key is null, the item will not be functional.

    • setItem

      default void setItem(int slot, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      This method will allow you to set a non-functional item in the menu.
      Parameters:
      slot - The slot to set the item in.
      item - The item to set.

    • addItem

      void addItem(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item, @Nullable @Nullable String functionKey)
      This method will allow you to add a functional item to the menu.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to add.
      functionKey - The function key to set.

    • addItem

      default void addItem(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      This method will allow you to add a non-functional item to the menu.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to add.

    • clearSlot

      void clearSlot(int slot)
      This method will allow you to clear a slot in the menu.
      Parameters:
      slot - The slot to clear.

    • open

      void open(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      This method will allow you to open the menu for a player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to open the menu for.

    • onOpen

      void onOpen(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryOpenEvent event)
      This method will allow you to listen to the open event of the menu.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who opened the menu.
      event - The event.

    • onClose

      void onClose(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryCloseEvent event)
      This method will allow you to listen to the close event of the menu.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who closed the menu.
      event - The event.

    • onClick

      void onClick(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
      This method will allow you to listen to the click event of the menu.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who clicked the menu.
      event - The event.

    • onFunctionClick

      void onFunctionClick(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @NotNull @NotNull MenuItem item, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
      This method will allow you to listen to the function click event of the menu.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who clicked the menu.
      item - The item that was clicked.
      event - The event.
